definition: A large quantity of something.
example_sentence: “The farmer was pleased with the abundance of crops this season.”

definition: To praise enthusiastically.
example_sentence: “The critic acclaimed the novel as a masterpiece.”

definition: An award or special recognition.
example_sentence: “She received an accolade for her outstanding performance.”

definition: Relating to sound or hearing.
example_sentence: “The concert hall has excellent acoustic properties.”

definition: To accept or comply without protest.
example_sentence: “She acquiesced to her supervisor’s request.”

definition: To gain or obtain.
example_sentence: “He acquired a new skill through practice.”

definition: To adjust to new conditions.
example_sentence: “He adapted quickly to the colder climate.”

definition: Difficulties or misfortune.
example_sentence: “Despite adversity, she remained determined to succeed.”

definition: To distribute resources for a particular purpose.
example_sentence: “The government allocated funds for education.”

definition: To refer to something indirectly.
example_sentence: “The book alludes to historical events.”

definition: Uncertainty or lack of clarity.
example_sentence: “The ambiguity of the statement caused confusion.”

definition: Open to multiple interpretations.
example_sentence: “Her response was ambiguous and left room for doubt.”

definition: Mixed feelings or contradictory attitudes.
example_sentence: “His ambivalence about moving was evident.”

definition: Lacking a clear structure or form.
example_sentence: “The painting had an amorphous quality.”

definition: Belonging to a different historical period.
example_sentence: “The film’s costumes were anachronistic.”

definition: Similar in some way.
example_sentence: “The relationship between the two species is analogous to that of wolves and dogs.”

definition: Based on personal accounts rather than facts or research.
example_sentence: “The evidence was largely anecdotal, making it difficult to draw firm conclusions.”

definition: Deviating from the norm or expectations.
example_sentence: “The scientist noted an anomalous result in the experiment.”

definition: A rough estimate or near calculation.
example_sentence: “The approximation of the building’s height was around 50 feet.”

definition: A high-ranking bishop in charge of a large region.
example_sentence: “The archbishop led the religious ceremony with great solemnity.”

definition: Requiring great effort or endurance.
example_sentence: “The hikers faced an arduous climb up the steep mountain.”

definition: Clever or deceitful trickery.
example_sentence: “His artifice allowed him to escape the difficult situation unscathed.”

definition: Strong desires or ambitions.
example_sentence: “Her aspirations to become a doctor motivated her to study diligently.”

definition: To state or declare something forcefully.
example_sentence: “He asserted his right to speak during the meeting.”

definition: To evaluate or analyze something.
example_sentence: “The teacher assessed the students’ essays carefully.”

definition: Showing great care and perseverance.
example_sentence: “Her assiduous work ethic earned her a promotion at the company.”

definition: A belief accepted as true without proof.
example_sentence: “The assumption that it would not rain led them to leave their umbrellas at home.”

definition: To serve as proof or evidence of something.
example_sentence: “The ancient ruins attest to the civilization’s advanced architectural skills.”

definition: To regard something as being caused by a particular source.

definition: To increase or add to.
example_sentence: “The company plans to augment its workforce by hiring more employees.”

definition: Indicating a favorable outcome or success.

definition: Severe or strict in manner; lacking luxury.
example_sentence: “The monastery had an austere lifestyle with minimal comforts.”

definition: Related to volcanic rock or lava.

definition: Demonstrating aggression or a willingness to fight.
example_sentence: “His bellicose remarks escalated the argument.”

definition: In a way that produces good results.

definition: Well-meaning and kindly.
example_sentence: “The benevolent organization provided food and shelter for the needy.”

definition: A body structure that is symmetrical on both sides.
example_sentence: “Humans and most animals exhibit bilateral symmetry in their anatomy.”

definition: A large ecological region characterized by distinct plant and animal life.
example_sentence: “The Amazon rainforest is one of the most diverse biomes on Earth.”

definition: To support or strengthen something.
example_sentence: “The government provided funds to bolster the struggling economy.”

definition: Honest and straightforward.
example_sentence: “She gave a candid response about her feelings.”

definition: Having a lot of space; roomy.
example_sentence: “The capacious backpack easily fit all of his belongings.”

definition: Given to sudden changes in mood or behavior.

definition: Something that speeds up a reaction or change.

definition: Related to the sky or outer space.

definition: To come together to form one whole.

definition: Convincing and logical.
example_sentence: “Her cogent argument persuaded the jury.”

definition: Clear and logical in thought or speech.

definition: Wound into a series of loops or spirals.

definition: To occur at the same time or to be in agreement.

definition: Corresponding in size, amount, or degree.

definition: Evoking interest or attention; convincing.

definition: Something given to make up for a loss or effort.

definition: Satisfied with oneself to a fault.

definition: The makeup or structure of something.

definition: To admit or acknowledge reluctantly.

definition: Providing a final decision or result.

definition: Making a certain outcome likely or possible.

definition: Combined or confused with something else.

definition: A meeting or coming together of things.

definition: Compliance with standards or social norms.

definition: A guess or speculation without complete evidence.

definition: The implied or associated meaning of a word.

definition: Significant or important.

definition: People who work to protect the environment.

definition: Combined or made stronger.

definition: Easily noticeable or attracting attention.

definition: To limit or restrict.

definition: To argue or compete.

definition: A disagreement or argument.

definition: To provide background or context.

definition: Dependent on certain conditions.

definition: To go against or oppose.

definition: Causing disagreement or debate.

definition: Based on tradition or what is generally accepted.

definition: The act of transporting something.

definition: Expressed or communicated.

definition: Complicated and difficult to understand.

definition: Abundant or plentiful.

definition: A connection or relationship between two things.

definition: To confirm or support with evidence.

definition: Shaped into alternating ridges and grooves.

definition: To reach a peak or final point.

definition: Increasing or growing over time.

definition: A sudden and disastrous failure.

definition: To weaken or impair.

definition: Determining an outcome or showing firmness.

definition: To reach a conclusion through reasoning.

definition: To postpone or delay.

definition: Harmful or damaging.

definition: To describe or outline precisely.

definition: Set apart or distinguished from something else.

definition: To represent or illustrate.

definition: Losing value over time.

definition: The lack or denial of something necessary.

definition: Lacking a clear plan or purpose.

definition: Causing harm or damage.

definition: A division between two opposing things.

definition: To spread out or scatter.

definition: To reduce in size or importance.

definition: Noticeable or able to be perceived.

definition: Lacking harmony or agreement.

definition: A difference or inconsistency.

definition: The ability to make responsible decisions or keep something confidential.

definition: To remove or force out from a position.

definition: To belittle or criticize.

definition: To spread widely.

definition: Not alike; different.

definition: Having a unique or distinguishing quality.

definition: The act of moving apart or differing.

definition: Developing in different directions.

definition: Inactive or temporarily not in use.

definition: Doubtful or questionable.

definition: Showing sincere and intense conviction.

definition: The ability to produce a desired effect.

definition: To draw out a response or reaction.

definition: Fluent and persuasive in speech or writing.

definition: To explain or clarify.

definition: Famous and respected in a field.

definition: The ability of a material to emit energy as radiation.

definition: To give special importance or stress to something.

definition: Based on observation or experience rather than theory.
